intro: Dipcadi polyphyllum, commonly known as the many-leaved buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its basal leaves that are divided into numerous lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. It prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in certain regions.
